TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit AutomationPropertyChangedEventArgs extends System.Windows.Automation.AutomationEventArgs

Docs.summary: Provides information about a property-changed event.

MemberSignature.Value: public AutomationPropertyChangedEventArgs (System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperty property, object oldValue, object newValue);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperty property, object oldValue, object newValue) cil managed

Docs.param: The identifier of the property that has changed.
The previous value of the property.
The new value of the property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks `oldValue` can be `null` (`Nothing` in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_visualbnet](~/includes/tlasharptla-visualbnet-md.md)]) if the previous value is not readily available.
## Examples The following example constructs and raises an event when a property has changed.
[!code-csharp[UIAFragmentProvider_snip#123](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAFragmentProvider_snip/CSharp/ListFragment.cs#123)] [!code-vb[UIAFragmentProvider_snip#123](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/UIAFragmentProvider_snip/VisualBasic/ListFragment.vb#123)]

Docs.summary: Gets the new value of a property that has changed.
Docs.value: The new value of the property.

remarks.format: ## Remarks UI Automation clients must cast the value to the expected type for the property.

Docs.summary: Gets the old value of a property that has changed.
Docs.value: The previous value of the property, or null ( in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_visualbnet](~/includes/tlasharptla-visualbnet-md.md)]) if the previous value is not readily available.

remarks.format: ## Remarks UI Automation clients must cast the value to the appropriate type for the property.

Docs.summary: Gets an identifier indicating which property changed.
Docs.value: The identifier of the property that has changed.
